_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The four kinds of deeds [an4.235:4.3]: Dark and bright deeds with dark and bright results
Neither dark nor bright deeds with neither dark nor bright results, which lead to the ending of deeds
Using alcoholic drinks that cause negligence
Bright deeds with bright results [an4.23: Not using alcoholic drinks that cause negligence
Dark and bright deeds with dark and brig: Making both hurtful and pleasing choices by way of body
Making both hurtful and pleasing choices by way of speech
Making both hurtful and pleasing choices by way of mind
Neither dark nor bright deeds with neith: The intention to give up dark deeds with dark results
The intention to give up bright deeds with bright results
The intention to give up both dark and bright deeds with both dark and bright results.
